question.title: Start WinSW service on startup
question.body:
I have a Rest API application that will be deployed as a service on a Windows machine. I have already made the service work using WinSW, but I need the service to be started automatically on Windows boot.

How can I do this?

Currently on Windows 10. My application is on Java Springboot. My XML:

<service>
    <id>restaurante-popular</id>
    <name>Restaurante Popular</name>
    <description>Sistema de gerenciamento do Restaurante Popular rodando como servi√ßo Windows.</description>
    
    <executable>java</executable>
    <arguments>-jar "%BASE%\restaurante-popular-0.0.1-SNAPSHOT.jar"</arguments>
    
    <logpath>%BASE%\logs</logpath>
    <log mode="roll"/>

    <onfailure action="restart" delay="5 sec"/>
</service>

Tried the customize command, available at the documentation. No success.
